Method Detail

create

F create(VkontakteAuthToken token)
Called when logged in Vkontakte user doesn't exists in current database
Parameters:
token - information about current authnetication
Returns:
just created user

findUser

F findUser(VkontakteAuthToken token)
Tries to find existing user for Vkontakte Token
Parameters:
token - information about current authnetication
Returns:
existing user, or null if there is no user for specified userId

getAccessToken

java.lang.String getAccessToken(F user)
Parameters:
user - target user
Returns:
current access_token, or null if not exists

getAppUser

A getAppUser(F user)
Return main (spring security user domain) for given Vkontakte user. If it's same domain, just return passed argument.
Parameters:
user - instance of Vkontakte domain
Returns:
instance of spring security domain

getPrincipal

java.lang.Object getPrincipal(A user)
Returns `principal` that will be stored into Security Context. It's good if it implements org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails or java.security.Principal. Btw, it's ok to return same object here.
Parameters:
user - current app user (main spring security core domain instance)
Returns:
user to put into Security Context

getProvidedUser

F getProvidedUser(A user)
Returns Vkontakte user for given spring security user.
Parameters:
user - instance of spring security domain
Returns:
instance of Vkontakte user domain

getRoles

java.util.Collection getRoles(F user)
Roles for current user
Parameters:
user - current user
Returns:
roles for user

hasValidToken

boolean hasValidToken(F user)
Parameters:
user - target user
Returns:
false when user have invalid token, or don't have token

updateToken

void updateToken(F user, VkontakteAuthToken token)
Setup a new Vkontakte Access Token if needed. Could be called with existing token, so implementation should check this case.
Parameters:
user - target user
token - valid access token
